KOLADAISI  
               i.UTME requirements plus two (2) subjects passed at the 'A' 
level, one(1) of which should be Accounting and the other either 
Economics or Business Management.            ii. In Exceptional cases 
the following qualifications may also be considered:  
a. UTME requirements plus a complete pass in the intermediate 
examination of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of 
Nigeria or of any other equivalent  
Professional Accounting bodies or  
b. UTME requirements plus passes in all parts of the  
Associateship Examination of the Institute of Bankers.  or  
c. UTME requirements plus ND upper credit in Marketing or any 
relevant subject from a recognised Polytechnic or College of 
Technology.  
d. UTME requirements  plus HND in any relevant programme 
awarded by a recognised Polytechnic or College of Technology.  
e. UTME requirements  plus a bachelor’s degree in any  
programme awarded by a recognised University.  
(xii) ABU accepts two (2) 'A' level/IJMB passes in 
Management/Social Science Subjects one of which must be 
Economics.  
(xiii) CALABAR ac cepts five (5) ‘O’ level credit passes, including 
English Language and Government, a pass in Mathematics, 
plus two (2) 'A' level subjects in the Social Sciences with a 
minimum of C.  
(xiv) KWASU accepts  
a. For Accounting IJMB, Cambridge ONLY, ND upper 
credit in  
Accounting, HND Accounting (Lower Credit)  
b. For Business Administration IJMB, Cambridge 
ONLY, ND upper credit in Business Administration, HND 
lower credit in Business Administration.  
(xv) PAUL accepts two (2) 'A' level passes chosen from Economics, 
Accounting, Business Management, Government and 
Geography.  
(xvi) BELLS accepts  two (2) 'A' Level passes in any two (2) of 
Chemistry, Economics, Geography and Mathematics.  
(xvii) EBSU accepts for Public Administration candidates with NCE, 
ND or HND, the candidates are expected t o possess the 
relevant UTME requirements
